CatDescriptText: Mr. Mark Ilyankoff, janitor, Oakland and Mrs. Pearl Leeper, casket worker, Hill District were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 20, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe fares would be lower and service better on trolleys and buses if the city owned and operated these services?"  Mr. Ilyankoff's answer reads: "I think that it would be a lot cheaper in rates and the service better."  Mrs. Leeper's answer reads: "I do believe that fares would be cheaper and service better if the city operated the transit system and put on all buses."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mark Ilyankoff wearing light colored long sleeved shirt with opened collar, posed outdoors with building in background; Portrait of Pearl Leeper wearing light colored short sleeved blouse, posed outdoors with Atlantic station in background
